info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 3:46PM CDT by NWS Quad Cities IA IL
info.description:
At 346 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Andalusia, or 7 miles southwest of Rock Island, moving northeast at 30 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Strong winds could break small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects.
Locations impacted include... Davenport, Moline, Rock Island, Bettendorf, East Moline, Silvis, Eldridge, Colona, Milan, Le Claire, Coal Valley, Hampton, Buffalo, Andalusia, Rapids City, Reynolds, Riverdale, Oak Grove, Cleveland, and Taylor Ridge.
This includes the following highways... Interstate 74 in Iowa between mile markers 1 and 5. Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 294 and 306. Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 8. Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 11. Interstate 88 between mile markers 1 and 3. Interstate 280 between mile markers 5 and 18.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Torrential rainfall is occurring and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Stay away from flooded areas. Report any flooding to local law enforcement.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

parameter.value: A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Mercer, southeastern Rock Island, northwestern Henry, southeastern Scott and eastern Muscatine Counties through 430 PM CDT

area.areaDesc: Muscatine; Scott; Rock Island; Henry; Mercer
